messageBody:
On 7/12/07, David Saff <saff@...> wrote:

> > As far as the categories go, I would like to see a simple method-level
> > annotation that looks like this:
> >
> > @TestGroups={"nightly", "quick", "bug"}
>
> Any takers on identifying categories with classes?
>
> @TestGroups({Nightly.class, Quick.class, Bug.class})
>
> I'm thinking:
>
> - auto-completion
> - refactoring
> - easy hook for running (just run Nightly.class to get the Nightly build)
> - easy place for further customization (@BeforeClass, @AfterClass, etc)

Interesting thought, but an advantage of string groups is that you can
run your tests by specifying group regexps (very powerful).

For example, some of our users define groups such as
"database.accounts", "database.people", or "win32.gui".

Then you can run an entire category of groups by including
"database.*" or you can be more specific by including
"database.people" if you know your latest change only touched code
that modifies the table PEOPLE.

--
Cédric
